description: From Middle English fort, from Middle French fort (“strong”) (adjective use is from Old French). Doublet of fortis and forte.

entries.meaning: A fortified defensive structure stationed with troops.
(historical) An outlying trading-station, as in British North America.
A structure improvised from furniture, bedding, etc., for playing games.
examples: The kids built a fort out of chairs and pillows.

verbs.description: fort (third-person singular simple present forts, present participle forting, simple past and past participle forted)

entries.meaning: To create a fort, fortifications, a strong point, or a redoubt.
